intro: Audibertia stachyoides var. revoluta, commonly known as the revolute audibertia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves with a distinctive revolute margin. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils.
